definitions.definition: available to do what you want with rather than work

examples.text: He's studying music in his **spare time**.
I haven't had a spare moment this morning.

definitions.definition: that is not being used or is not needed at the present time

examples.text: We've got a spare bedroom, if you'd like to stay.
I'm afraid I haven't got any **spare cash**.
Are there any tickets **going spare** *(= are there any available, not being used by somebody else)*?

definitions.definition: kept in case you need to replace the one you usually use; extra

examples.text: Take some spare clothes in case you get wet.

definitions.definition: to become very angry or upset

examples.text: Your mum would go spare if she knew!
I’ll go spare if I don’t get out of the house soon!

wordOrigin: Old English spær ‘not plentiful, meagre’, sparian ‘refrain from injuring’, ‘refrain from using’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German sparen ‘to spare’.
